intro: Dichapetalum subfalcatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved dichapetalum, is a deciduous shrub native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Bignoniaceae and is characterized by its opposite, lanceolate leaves that are often hairy underneath. The plant produces showy, yellowish-white flowers that are clustered in terminal racemes, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and natural landscapes.
